Once upon a time. We'd get press tab and look at our enemies fancy portraits decked with gold and shiny gems, or maybe just a simple bronze border with 2 stars beneath it. We'd get hype when leveling up getting a lootbox and waiting patiently. Sometimes you got a singular blue victory pose for a hero you've never played. Sometimes you got that emote you really wanted.

Now? Now we just play for the "Team" and our "Rank" and pay 20 dollars for skins we could've gotten for free but just having fun. It's all competitive now. Go play TF2 for a casual game where you can fuck around and buy cosmetics for all 9 characters for 5 dollars.

How far you have fallen. I guess the game really is headed underground.

Wow, the audacity of Blizzard to bring this game to steam.
They really must be getting desperate for mone- ermh, I mean, players.

For those that are completely unaware, the short summary of what has happened, excluding all the other Blizzard scandals and flops, is that the original Overwatch was put on life support after they announced that OW2 was coming, with the main focus being PvE for the sequel. Fast forward, they finally released OW2, except there was no promised PvE and it was just Overwatch 1 with cut features, a balance update, a paid battle pass and pretty much removing the ability to earn skins by playing.  They basically took away the product that people had paid for previously and filled it with a cash shop. 
They did also show a roadmap that hinted that the PvE will be coming after a few seasons. Okay that's not the worst, right? Give players the updated PvP early to build hype for PvE that's coming soon. Well, they didn't hold up to their release date promises and delayed the PvE further with no confirmed released date. The community was left in the dark and let down yet again. 

Now in recent months they came forward and said that they're giving up on the original promises of vastly replayable PvE mode with a progression and customization system and will instead release story missions spread out, bit by bit. Missions that most likely are glorified versions of PvE event missions from the original Overwatch, which are no longer available due to the release of OW2. They even dared to say that they're doing all of this to focus on what "players really want", which apparently is ongoing support for PvP.

So they want you to pay money for butchered PvE that will probably take a bit over an hour to finish.  

I don't think I'll go on more about all the other little details that have happened during the lifespan of OW2, but let's just say that the balancing team is still incompetent and the game now has a predatory monetization system.
The recent Diablo 4 release was also terrible, clearly all of their talent has left the company long ago. I've also heard that WoW and Hearthstone are having increasing monetization features.
So in summary, Activision Blizzard is probably the scummiest gaming company and it doesn't deserve your money or leeway from criticism. Overwatch being a victim of their greed and now just a shadow of it's former self.
Bobby Kotick is probably going to cry into his dollar bills about how he is the victim again and that everyone else is wrong.
Takes money for the PVE missions. L Bozo game.

O verdadeiro clássico, agora disponível na Steam! Tão bom e divertido que a Valve tentou de tudo pra competir, até fez um jogo inspirado chamado Team Fortress 2 que não agradou nem um pouco o grande público por conta de suas partidas cheias de desbalanceamento, paywalls, personagens chatos, mal desenvolvidos e sem carisma, fora que até 2016 ele NÃO tinha matchmaking (sério meu, até 2016, na era dos eSports, a Valve se RECUSAVA a se adaptar aos tempos modernos). Спасибо разрабам за скин клоуна, не зря игру 5 лет назад купил. А ещё за огрызок от первой части с цифрой "2" в названии.

As a longtime Overwatch fan and player on Battle.net since 2016 (a little under 500 hrs of gameplay in OW1), I can't recommend this iteration of the game at all (spent less than 10 hours playing OW2). The old lootbox and credit systems were much less money-hungry and way more rewarding than the new half-baked battlepasses and FOMO-focused shop cosmetics; old players have been pushed aside in lieu of attracting new fans who don't know what used to be and will blindly give Blizzard money for every little update or cosmetic based on their experiences with other f2p shooters. 

The battlepass would be more worthwhile even if you could just fill past seasons, reducing the fear of missing out on cosmetics when you can't or don't want to play. I didn't buy a single battlepass knowing I didn't like the game's changes enough to ever play beyond level 10 or 20, even though I liked some of the cosmetics enough to consider buying.

Not to mention the game was released in a basically broken state, essentially an unfinished beta. Systems like end cards and endorsements, earning credits for won games, level borders and medals, on-fire, competitive rank updates between every match, 2CP mode and entire maps, and long-term PvE missions were all removed on launch and have barely started to return. The new 5v5 format is still struggling to feel balanced (since the original team roles were built around 6v6) and makes playing any role except DPS a chore; if you have one bad tank you've basically lost.

4 years of waiting for Overwatch 2 (more like 0.5) were absolutely not worth it, and the worst part is no longer being able to play the game I once enjoyed playing daily, the game I actually didn't mind paying for. The Invasion update is inviting as the start of something bigger, but unless it proves to be worth replaying (aka worth the money), it's going to fall flat after the initial hype dies down, since people can just watch gameplay of the missions for free online. Until Blizzard returns to rewarding its playerbase well instead of treating them like living wallets, or they add a legacy edition of the game, I can't see myself ever playing regularly. The only reason I have OW2 installed now is to gather art references and admire the art team's hard work, check my playtime stats for this review, and clinging onto hope that the trainwreck can eventually be steered back onto its rail.

[h1] As an OW veteran with over 3k hours poured into this franchise along with achieving top 500 status multiple times in a 7 year span, I cannot fathom how they massacred my boy. [/h1]

Rant: Before I start this review, I just wanna say that I wish OW1 was back. It wasn't a perfect or flawless game by any means, but at least it had a decent progression system and didn't have predatory micro-transactions built into it. OW2 doesn't need to exist, they just needed a competent balancing team in OW1 that actually knew wtf they were doing and updated the game with more content. Apparently that wasn't the case and was just too much to ask. Just like the PVE mode was too much to do. Poor little Indie company with a small loan of $70 billion dollars can't dish out what they promised.

Review:

"I loved the part when Reinhardt said, HAMMER DOWN!! and shattered all of the PVE concepts into oblivion. What a powerful and truly inspirational moment."

Nothing pisses me off more than wasted potential and that is Blizzard's middle name. This really could've been something great, but this is just another franchise that was completely [b] destroyed [/b], [b] brutalized [/b], [b] dismantled [/b], [b] eradicated [/b], and [b] gutted [/b] by corporate greed, false promises and anti-consumerism. The whole selling point of OW2 was the, you guessed it, PVE. DO NOT be blinded by this so called "PVE" they just regurgitated out to try and earn back their consumer's respect (and money, mostly the money). They have promised key features for PVE such as 150+ story missions, skill-trees, and a fully fledged out campaign story mode that improves on all the lore of the characters for 4 YEARS only to come out and tell us on 5/16/2023 that PVE was canceled; shocking the entire fandom and decimating morale for both the developers and fans. Although there is a hollow shell of 'PVE' here for, ahem $15, this is not even a fraction of what Blizzard had promised to us fans, or should I say FORMER fans. 

"I loved the part when Zenyatta said, walk along the path to live service. What a glorious moment to remind us all of the current state of gaming." 

This ain't the only time they have lied to their consumers about OW related topics. Activision Blizzard are some scumbag liars by saying Overwatch 1 would be cross-compatible with Overwatch 2., news flash, it's not, they just removed the product the consumer paid for and gave you this downgraded version of the original game instead. Not to mention lying AGAIN during the transition from OW1 to OW2, saying that you wouldn't be needing your Overwatch 1 coins for Overwatch 2 and to spend them while you still can. NEWSFLASH, you can get items easily with the Overwatch 1 coins, it's almost as if they made us all waste our coins from Overwatch 1 to use their NEW CURRENCY that you have to pay REAL MONEY for! Overwatch does NOT need to have live service BS implemented into it and definitely does NOT need to be pay to win. 

"I loved the part when Kiriko said, Let the Micro-transactions guide you! A tear inducing moment and truly a peak Overwatch experience."

The micro-transactions in this game are a huge problem since Blizzard does not care about your time or your money. In OW1, there was no shop where you had to spend money on cosmetics. In OW1, there were lootboxes and those lootboxes contained items ranging from common, rare, epic, and legendary quality. I know lootboxes are ludicrous as well, but they were much better than whatever the hell this crap is with an in-game shop where you have to spend 1900 in-game coins which is $20 dollars on a single skin. If you so choose to grind out this particular skin, you will have to complete weekly challenges that only offer around 60 coins a week (That's IF you manage to complete all the challenges that week). To get that skin that costs 1900 coins, you will be playing nearly 32 weeks or 8 months worth of Overwatch to get that ONE SKIN. The bundles in this game range from $25 to nearly $50 goddamn dollars. With the lootboxes in OW1, you were almost guaranteed to get some good loot just by playing the game and earning them lootboxes along the way. 

Overwatch is the kind of game where you switch heroes to counter the enemy team which is exactly WHY heroes, especially OP ones, should NOT be LOCKED behind a PAY-WALL for this particular game! If you haven't bought the battle pass to get a certain character that is powerful/broken, guess what, YOU LOSE! FUN!!! BATTLE PASS DIFFERENTIAL!!! 

This really used to be something special back in 2016-2017 and they just pissed all over its iconic glory. IT WON GAME OF THE FREAKING YEAR FOR CRYING OUT LOUD and ended up being in THIS state. This just goes to show that companies can VERY EASILY kill off a franchise by being greedy corporate scumbags. No wonder Jeff from the Overwatch Team left. Rip Overwatch 2016-2023, ruined and desecrated by Activision Blizzard. 

Overall Rating: OW 0.9/10. The fanart is at least good.

暴雪，我草死你的吗，你最近两年的公关和运营像一坨烂屎，考迪克更是个死妈玩意，让你糊在我村头的茅厕的墙上都嫌你太恶心，就你干的这档子司马事，你妈死一万遍都不够偿还债务的，户口本凑不出两页来
首先
这游戏刚出内会就是个半成品，玩过的都知道是个什么成分，压根就不配叫守望先锋2或者说守望先锋归来，归西差不多（虽然确实后来国服归西了）BUG多就算了，UI画的还是一坨史，UI一坨史就算了，堡垒和托比昂第一赛季出了个BUG（我暂且不说这是本来就不该出的弱智BUG）暴雪发现这个BUG之后，先暂时删除了堡垒和托比昂，然后开始修，一直修了15天，到下次补丁才上线。我不知道一个代码上的东西，是怎么修这么长时间的，我也不在乎暴雪内部有什么问题，这件事首先暴雪态度上就已经有问题了，一个代码上的小bug，换别的游戏直接俩小时内就热修了，暴雪家写代码的是干什么吃的？后面小美也出了类似的事，也一样是先把英雄禁用了，过了半个月才放出来（已经是去年的事了，有些细节记不清了可能有谬误）
其次
稀烂平衡我不想多说了，面多加水水多加面，而且跟着职业赛场上调整，我寻思你还不明白吗，六年了到底是谁在玩你们的游戏啊？
没有广大平民玩家你职业联赛开的起来么？心里没数？同一个英雄在职业哥手里和在平民玩家手里表现能一样？职业哥真是你爹啊？
手感改来改去，有时候我一个月不上游戏甚至都不会玩了，麦克雷从一开始的六连能秒猪，射速很快削到现在下水道英雄，狗都不拿，黑百合原本作为一个以可以造成远程击杀为特色的长枪位,本来上限很高，硬是削到50米开外一枪爆头一个200血的脆皮不死,我不明白暴雪是怎么想的，能这么做平衡
此外一些零零散散的小事懒得说了，国服关闭那档子烂事我觉得我也不用多说，大伙都知道，我只能说千万别相信暴雪，相信暴雪只能让自己像个小丑。你要是喜欢那种被背叛的感觉另说。暴雪就是个司马公司，前几年也许还行，但这几年，真不行，早名存实亡了。
这次上steam，兄弟们想玩到守望更容易了，之前一直有的限制必须绑定外区手机号,前两天也取消了，我的建议是兄弟们回来玩玩可以，白嫖他的服务器可以，但真的强烈不建议充钱，咱也不整道德绑架那一套的，就暴雪干的这事是真配不上大伙对他的期望吧。
多的不说了，祝暴雪早日倒闭，考迪克早日死亡

A little story before i get to my personal thoughts of this Overwatch "sequel."

This game was one of the many childhood games i've always wanted the chance to play. I remember getting it on my PS4 (but not even playing it on there) and waited for the opporitunity to get Overwatch on my PC. Then around December 2020/January 2021 Blizzard published a free trial of Overwatch 1, and I had to get it. Unfortunatley like with the PS4, I didn't play it so much. Then a year later, two days before Overwatch 2 released with Season 1, I bought Overwatch 1 on PC. When the trial of Overwtch 1 happened and when I bought the game on PC, all I would do for some reason is go to the practice range and mess around for a bit, and not even play the actual game for some reason. It's kinda funny. But with Overwatch 2's release, I got to play Overwatch a bit more and understand the game a lot better now that I have access to it.

Now on my personal thoughts on how Overwatch 2 became, It's not great. even though I have little experience with Overwatch 1, I kinda prefer to either go back to Overwatch 1 entirely or at least find a way to bring back 6v6 PvP. But it's not just that.

The game now has a battle pass instead of loot boxes,  and loot boxes were really player-friendly at the time. You would always wonder what you're gonna get after playing the game, and even sometimes get loot boxes from special events. Nowadays with this clunky-ass battle pass and shop systems, all Blizzard wants is your credit card to get all of the cosmetics you want, and it's just stupid. Sure, it makes them money, but I would rather focus more on players than money.

The gameplay is fine. It's just the same Overwatch with some new systems and game modes (minus Assault/2CP) and it's fine. The replay-ability is kinda debatable though, and even the competitive scene is also just whack compared to Overwatch 1. So wack to the point where people think ranking up is entirely RNG-based, and most of the time (i guess) it's bad, at least for me. But i don't wanna talk about that.

Also, the beloved PvE with skill trees and extra things that I forgot because this game was announced like 4 years ago now (as of the time of this review) and with what we all have now, most of what we were promised was cut, and the story missions are paid instead of free. The paid story missions I can kinda get because Blizzard really wants to be Microsoft so bad with their Halo Infinite campaign but whatever.

Play this game if you want, but just know that if you are gonna get addicted to this "sequel" of a game, you might need some sort of wallet with you.

В Overwatch 1 и 2 у меня наиграна в общем 1000+ часов за 7 лет игры. 
Думаю каждый человек, который играл в первую часть или в другие игры данной кампании, знает что 
Blizzard самые жадные, глупые вруны и наsiльники. Я бы с вами хотел пройтись по значимым успехам этой игры (Которые у меня всплывают думая о данной "Серии" игр)

* В 2016 выходит игра, ловит награды, радует игроков ивентами и бесплатными скинами. После релиза вышло 2 новых персонажа.
* В 2017 Blizzard решили не делать новые ивенты.  Вышло 3 новых персонажа.
* В 2018 с сундуков перестают падать так много дубликатов. А новый контент мы получаем только с ивента Архивов. Вышло 3 новых персонажа.
* В 2019 появились на свет Батист и Сигма, а в 2020 Эхо.
* С 2019 по 2023 близы прекратили что-то делать и сделали упор на 2 часть игры и её ПВЕ с прокачкой персонажей, умениями, что-то типа рейдов.


̤А̤ ̤Т̤Е̤П̤Е̤Р̤Ь̤ ̤М̤О̤Ё̤ ̤Н̤А̤Г̤О̤Р̤Е̤ВШЕЕ + Интересные факты!!!

*Маккри... ой извините это старый сценарий. Я хотел сказать КоЛ Кэссиди бедный персонаж, который был переименован из-за того что в офисе BlizzardКоМпАрЕйШеН был человек с таким именем и он творил плохие вещи. Надеюсь все в мире с именем Маккри теперь меняют паспорта, а то не дело.
* В 2022 году у всех обладателей Overwatch была изъята игра, а взамен дали костюм ШУТА для Сомбры. Ну вы поняли у всех забрали честно купленную игру и дали бесполезный скин.
* На старте БЕСПЛАТНОЙ игры Overwatch 2 оценки пользователей составили 1.1 из 10 XD
* Чтобы купить все скины из первой части, нужно потратить всего $$$12 тысяч$$$
* В 2022 году близы получили награду "золотая малина" за самый худший БатлПасс в играх. И это реально самая лучшая награда, которую может получить эта игра.
* Турбосвин играю на нём все 7 лет и я думаю многие уже меня поймут. В 2017 году персонаж получил 5 патрон, скорость стрельбы, но потерял много урона из-за чего перестал убивать многих с 1 выстрела. И ЧЕРЕЗ 5 ЛЕТ, когда в игре остался 1 танк, нытики наныли нерф Хога и теперь он самый слабый герой, но с 6 патронами (Да Blizzard всегда взамен дают 1 патрон и забирают урон) И теперь я жду реворка, который обещали через 1 ГОД! Ну разве не угарно.
* А теперь поговорю о других танках...
^ Таран удивительный герой с самой большой мобильностью, отсутствием хедшотов, 150 брони у него регенется само, одним его скилом можно нанести 400 урона с кд в 5 секунд. А ещё его каждый патч апают ведь он такой Няшный ( Это слова игроков на Таране )
^ ДумФист... ещё один персонаж с самой большой мобильностью, возможностью застанить 2 персонажей и убить 1-2 за время стана. Надеюсь что этого индивида который делал реворк не уволили и он сейчас работает над реворком ТурбоСвина.
^ Королева ну это просто худой ТурбоСвин, у которого больше урона, вампиризм, меньше моделька и скилы сильнее...
* У Винстона и ТурбоСвина только два скила, когда у всех других танков по 3.
* В игре появились мифические сеты, которые можно кастомизировать. Так вот сет на Генгу оболтус делал 4 года. Да 4 года он сам так заявил, ну, то есть ему платили ЗП все 4 года, а он вам вместо ПВЕ сет на Генгу делал.

Rating: ★★★★☆ (4/5)

As a fervent fan of the original Overwatch, I approached the announcement of Overwatch® 2 with a mix of excitement and apprehension. Would it be able to capture the magic of its predecessor while bringing enough new elements to the table? After getting my hands on the game, I can confidently say that Overwatch® 2 not only lives up to the hype but also surpasses it in several ways.

Visual Brilliance: From the moment you enter the game, it's evident that Blizzard has poured their heart and soul into refining the visual experience. The character models are more detailed, environments are richer, and the overall level of polish is remarkable. The seamless blend of familiar characters with fresh designs perfectly bridges the gap between nostalgia and innovation.

Expansive Hero Roster: While some beloved characters return with updated abilities and fresh looks, Overwatch® 2 introduces new heroes that immediately feel like they've been part of the universe since day one. These additions inject new strategies into the game, ensuring that every match remains dynamic and unpredictable. Whether you're a veteran Genji player or eager to master a brand new hero, there's something for everyone.

Story-Driven Gameplay: The inclusion of a robust story mode is a significant step forward. Engaging narrative missions not only delve into the lore of the Overwatch universe but also serve as an excellent way to familiarize yourself with heroes you might not have spent much time with in the original game. The cooperative nature of these missions encourages team coordination and fosters a sense of camaraderie.

PvP Perfection: If you're a fan of competitive gameplay, Overwatch® 2 continues to shine here. The refined balance, new maps, and mode updates breathe fresh life into the PvP experience. It's evident that Blizzard has listened to the community, and the result is a more refined and exhilarating gameplay loop.

Customization and Progression: The addition of a comprehensive player progression system adds another layer of engagement. Unlocking new cosmetics, leveling up heroes, and customizing abilities provide a sense of achievement beyond the match victories themselves.

Blizzard's Commitment: It's clear that Blizzard is committed to the long-term success of Overwatch® 2. The promise of free hero and map updates post-launch shows their dedication to keeping the community engaged and the game's meta ever-evolving.

In conclusion, Overwatch® 2 is a triumph. It respects the essence of the original while pushing the boundaries of what the Overwatch universe can offer. Whether you're a die-hard fan of the franchise or a newcomer looking for a rich, team-based shooter, Overwatch® 2 is an absolute must-play. Get ready to join the battle once again and experience a new era of heroism.

Più che Overwatch 2 si dovrebbe chiamare Overwatch 0.5...
Partendo dal lancio di OW2: Hanno aggiunto 3 eroi, qualche mappa e una modalità....questo dovrebbe essere un sequel? e la modalità pve che avevate promesso che fine ha fatto?

Facendola breve:
-Hanno rimosso le lootbox, per ogni cosa adesso devi sganciare di tasca tua.
-Hanno rimosso i livelli personali perchè a quanto pare è brutto dare un senso di progresso al giocatore.
-Hanno aggiunto il battlepass ovviamente a pagamento perchè ovviamente non puoi fare un multiplayer nel 2023 senza pass.
-Hanno rimandato il pve per dividerlo in pacchetti da vendere separatamente perchè overwatch è diventato una macchina spilla soldi senza un minimo di ritegno.
-I prezzi delle skin sono assurdi e passando da OW1 in cui si ricevevano skin a profusione a OW2 in cui si ricevono 60 crediti a settimana è veramente una presa in giro. (Una skin costa minimo 1900 crediti quindi fatevi un rapido calcolo per quanto tempo vi serva per comprarne UNA)

In pratica adesso una persona comune dovrebbe giocare ad OW2 per non ricevenere nessun tipo di premio, nessun livello, nessuna ricompensa, nessuna progressione...niente di niente e ci sono persone che gli regalano anche soldi...

Per non parlare della "modalità pve", semplicemente sono gli eventi pve che rilasciavano ma con nuovi nemici venduti come chissà cosa a 15 euro per 3 missioni...veramente ridicoli...

Верните 2к которые я потратил в 2016

5k+ hours in Overwatch 1 & 2 and I promise you - there is not a game company that despises its own player-base as much as new Blizzard, and they’ve said this many times. 

Built from an era of true gamers with a love for creating worlds, environments and games that could envelop and feed the soul, AB is a hollow and blood-sucking company, draining every last drop of what these games used to be. 

Very few (if any) of the original developers and adored members work at Blizzard anymore, they’ve slowly dropped like flies at the disdain for the company and what it’s done to the players all in the name of greed and money. Seeing their passion projects gutted like this must break their hearts. 

A true testament to this, is knowingly selling a remake/remodel of Overwatch solely for the aspect of PVE, weather and (many more) different maps and then SCRAPPING ALL OF IT, without so much as offering their players a refund. Many suspect they never intended to even go through with it to begin with. 

-Next, some of the skins you would pay 15-20$+ for today were FREE in Overwatch 1. 
-They revolve their meta around overpowered pay-to-win characters and whatever they’re selling during that months BP. 
-They hid ways to see players time and hours put in the game as to not deter new players, completely diminishing your efforts for new $$$.
-AB has scammed E-sports teams millions of dollars for their roster position then completely scrapped that project, too. 
-They oftentimes don't offer their dedicated streamers first looks or beta keys, their PR team offers random YouTubers and streamers keys who've never even played the game, further disrespecting their own community. 

This is cheap money-making machine with an IV attached to its player’s wallets. They don’t care about you in the slightest, and the gameplay has obviously suffered because of this greatly: it’s simply not a fun or rewarding experience when metas revolve around shareholders. 

There are a thousand more reasons to avoid this game and company entirely but I hope that if they thought tapping into the Steam revenue with more DLCs would be fruitful for them, they’re sorely disappointed, as we have always been. 

Save yourself a lot of misery and just -- don’t.
